## Use IPA Composition to structure the motion â®•
This is good for stabilising the motion between chaotic images.

You can also layer lots of other control methods onto this ðŸ¤”

## A note on VRAM:
The most significant impacter on RAM is IP-Adapter - each application eats up around 0.8GB VRAM.

The Batch Creative Interpolation node applies one IP-Adapter per frame.

If high detail mode is on, the uses 2x IP-Adapters.

With this in mind, I recommend turning off high-detail mode unless you need it.

If your generations are running slow, it also might mean your Comfy is running on low VRAM mode.

## Understanding the settings
There are 3 main settings:
- Key frame position - Length of influence - Strength of influence
The 'type_of' fields decide whether each of settings are the same for each frame or different.
When the type has been set to 'linear', you can adjust the value for every in with the _value fields.
When the type is set to 'dynamic', the text box below each setting are for the individual values - follow the format provided to set values for each frame.

### Set duration of frame influence â®•
1.0 equals around the distance between this and the next frames, 2.0 equals twice this. You can set these values for each frame individually in the field below.

### Set low and high point of strength â®•
The number are the range the strength runs from and to.

### High detail mode â®•
This makes the frames significantly more detailed by using two IPAs - but results in each frame consumes twice as much RAM.

# A brief guide
## Philosophy for getting the most from this:
This isnâ€™t a tool like text to video that will perform well out of the box - itâ€™s more like a paint brush, an artistic tool that you need to figure out how to get the best from.
Through trial and error, you'll need to build an understanding of how the motion and settings work, what its limitations are, which inputs work best with it, etc.
If you can figure out how to wield it, this approach can provide enough control for you to make beautiful things that match your imagination precisely.
## How to use this:
1.Input the images that you want to use. The most important thing that will influence the quality and coherence of your creation is the input images.
2.Try the basic settings to start. Based on the resulting generation, try to understand what happened - you can learn about the settings and observe the graphs to the right.
3.Tweak the settings until you achieve your desired effect.
## What this will & won't be suitable for:
I believe that this will be good for a wide range of storytelling-driven and abstract motion.

However, it probably won't be good for realistic motion - other approaches like vid2vid are far more suitable for this.

## If you're having problems:
First, download the latest version of this workflow from [here](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/peteromallet/steerable-motion/main/demo/creative_interpolation_example.json) and get the latest version of the node from Comfy Manager.
If that doesn't work, drop into [our Discord](https://discord.gg/V72vk8T67n) and share your problem and I'll try to help ASAP.
## Want to join a community of people who are pushing open source models to their technical and artistic limits?
You're welcome to join [our Discord](https://discord.gg/UJf6aum7WZ).
Please share anything you generate in the steerable-motion channel.

## You can add Motion LoRAs above
Training them is great for complex movements. You can learn more about this [here](https://github.com/ExponentialML/AnimateDiff-MotionDirector).

## To download these models from Comfy Manager
On the bar on the right, click "Manager", then click "Install Models" and search up the below - the models that show for those queries should be the right ones:

- For Animatediff, search: v3\_sd15\_mm - For SparseCtrl, search: v3\_sd15\_sparsectrl - For s3\_15 adapter, search: v3\_sd15\_adapter - For Clip Vision, search: CLIP-ViT-H-14 - For IP-Adapter-Plus, search: plus\_sd15.safetensors

For the VAE and styling model, *make sure to use SD 1.5 models*.

What else could you add to this workflow or node to do weird or interesting stuff? ðŸ¤”

Come join us in [our Discord](https://discord.gg/UJf6aum7WZ) if you have something interesting.

## Help me figure out advanced settings
I would like to bake good settings into the node so people can use it with confidence but I haven't quite figured out what these should be yet.

If you want to help me, you can unbypass these nodes and tweak away.

Some stuff I'm trying to figure out: - How should we implemnent noise? - What other weight types could make sense? - Is embed_scaling relevant and if so how should we use it? - How could we refine the start and end_steps? - ???

Please share any learnings in the #steerable-motion channel of the Banodoco Discord!

## â¬… Tweak motion_scale to change amount of movement
You can tweak motion_scale on the left to increase or decrease the amount of motion in the generation - just change the value in brackets.

You can also schedule motion scales with this format:

0:(1.3),16:(1.6)

Find the settings confusing and hard to understand? This is part of why we made [Dough](https://github.com/banodoco/dough) - an open-source creative tool that provides simple controls on top of this + much more :)

### Setting frame position â®•
Setting linear frame distribution makes the frames spaced out by the linear value - for example, if it's set to 16, the frames will be at positions 0, 16, 32, etc. If you set type to dynamic, you'll need to enter the values below.
If you can't see these nodes, you need to update the Steerable Moton node in Comfy Manager!
Make something amazing? Share it in the #art_sharing channel of [our Discord](https://discord.gg/UJf6aum7WZ).
To color match to the original frame, plug the image into the color match node.

## Tweak Sparse Ctrl end_percent to improve adherence â®•
Though the motion tends to be smoother on lower settings, increasing `end_percent` with improve adherence to the input images.
